graph

Class GraphPanel.Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • graph.GraphPanel.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    GraphPanel<V,E>

    public class GraphPanel.Line
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This graphics class allows the drawing of lines. Lines use a (c1, c2) coordinate system, where c1 and c2 are circle objects that denote the endpoints of this line. Each circle has (x, y) coordinates, so a Line can be though of as having (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    Author:
    MPatashnik
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        c1 - - the Circle that marks the first end of this line
        c2 - - the Circle that marks the second end of this line
        r - - the Edge this Line represents when drawn on the GUI
